DataElement.preferredDefinition: The dose unit associated with the concomitant medication taken.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Domain Concomitant Medication Dose Unit
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration._The unit of measure for the concomitant medication dose.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to concomitant medication administration.

Property.preferredDefinition: The unit of measure for the concomitant medication dose.

Concepts.definition: The unit of measure for the concomitant medication dose.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Elevated to Standard per governance approval by RA. 2021-6-9 ak. 12/18/18 TT released/MC.  created for CDASH 8/14/18LS

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time._A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product._A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a caplet.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a caplet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a capsule.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a capsule.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 0.05 milliliter (20 drops/ml).

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 0.05 milliliter (20 drops/ml).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional unit of liquid volume equal in the US customary system to 1/16 pint, or 1.804 687 cubic inches or 29.573 531 milliliters.

Concepts.definition: A traditional unit of liquid volume equal in the US customary system to 1/16 pint, or 1.804 687 cubic inches or 29.573 531 milliliters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

Concepts.definition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.

Concepts.definition: The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance equal to a millionth of a mole.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance equal to a millionth of a mole.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance equal to 0.001 mole.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance equal to 0.001 mole.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of proportion equal to 10E-6.

Concepts.definition: A unit of proportion equal to 10E-6.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An arbitrary dosing unit used predominantly for semisolid topical formulations such as cream, ointment, paste, etc. One fingertip unit is the amount of a product that is squeezed out from a standard tube with 5-millimeter diameter nozzle along an adult's fingertip. A fingertip length is defined from the tip of the index finger to the first finger crease. A fingertip dosing unit varies with age and size of the body. The average fingertip unit is equal to approximately 0.5 gram for an adult male and 0.4 gram for an adult female.

Concepts.definition: An arbitrary dosing unit used predominantly for semisolid topical formulations such as cream, ointment, paste, etc. One fingertip unit is the amount of a product that is squeezed out from a standard tube with 5-millimeter diameter nozzle along an adult's fingertip. A fingertip length is defined from the tip of the index finger to the first finger crease. A fingertip dosing unit varies with age and size of the body. The average fingertip unit is equal to approximately 0.5 gram for an adult male and 0.4 gram for an adult female.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to a metered dose of medicinal substance(s) that is delivered in uniform quantity upon each activation of a medical device (e.g. an inhaler), in which the dosage form is contained.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a puff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of medicinal substance(s) contained in a single item of a suppository dosage form that is designed for introduction into the orifice of the human body and usually melts, softens, or dissolves at body temperature.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a suppository.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume informally used in pharmacy. Under the metric system the tablespoon has been standardized at 15 milliliters in the US, Britain, Canada, and New Zealand, and at 20 milliliters in Australia and some European countries.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume informally used in pharmacy. Under the metric system the tablespoon has been standardized at 15 milliliters in the US, Britain, Canada, and New Zealand, and at 20 milliliters in Australia and some European countries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 5 milliliters.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 5 milliliters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to use active NCIt. mc 2/8/19

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concomitant Medication per CDISC CM Definition

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.:A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.:A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
A single undivided thing occurring in the composition of something else.

ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: added max length of 100 (ok per Chad Winch CCTG) released VD 6/9/22 cjl

DataElement.administrativeNotes: 6/9/22 added human readable definition, added sys gen def as alt, released CDE cjl.
